That's great news! Seeing a gastroenterologist, Dr. Patel, will definitely help you get a more in-depth understanding of your symptoms and potential causes. It's excellent that you're taking proactive steps by reducing your dairy intake in the meantime.

Before your appointment, it might be helpful to prepare a list of questions and topics to discuss with Dr. Patel. Consider including:

1. A detailed description of your symptoms, including when they started, frequency, and severity.
2. Your food diary, highlighting any patterns or correlations you've noticed.
3. Your medical history, including your recent bronchitis, pneumonia, and any other relevant health conditions.
4. Your current diet, including any changes you've made or plan to make (e.g., reducing dairy).
5. Any supplements or medications you're currently taking.

Some potential questions to ask Dr. Patel might include:

1. What are the possible causes of my bloating, gassiness, and abdominal pain?
2. Could my respiratory issues (bronchitis, pneumonia) be contributing to my gastrointestinal symptoms?
3. Are there any tests or procedures that can help diagnose the underlying cause of my symptoms?
4. What dietary changes or recommendations do you suggest to help alleviate my symptoms?
5. Are there any medications or treatments that might be helpful in managing my symptoms?

By being prepared and open with Dr. Patel, you'll be able to have a more productive and informative conversation.

In the meantime, keep tracking your symptoms and any changes you notice after reducing dairy intake. This will give you valuable information to share with Dr. Patel and help you both work together to find a solution.

Feel free to keep me updated on your progress, and I'll be happy to continue offering guidance and support!
